intro: Stenomesson luteoviride, commonly known as the yellow-green daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow-green ray florets and prominent yellow disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Stenomesson luteoviride is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit.
